title: gundam_age-fx
body:
The final lead Gundam of [[gundam_age|Mobile Suit Gundam AGE]]. It is piloted by the series' final protagonist, [[Kio Asuno]]. It is designed in real life by [[Ebikawa Kanetake]].

The Gundam AGE-FX is equipped with a pair of beam sabers in its forearms, similar to the [[gundam_age-3|AGE-3 Gundam AGE-3 Normal]]. The new Stungle Rifle is more powerful than the SigMaxiss Rifle and can be further enhanced with the Daidal Bazooka add-on. But the area where the Gundam AGE-FX shines is its C-Funnels, which are stored across its body. Kio can control these remote weapons with his mind, using them both offensively and defensively. The suit can also make use of [[FX Burst]], a high performance mode that dramatically raises its power levels at the cost of precision control. With the assistance of C-Funnels, Kio can fight equally against Vagan X-Rounders and their remote bit-equipped mobile suits.

The head design of Gundam AGE-FX is different among other Gundam-type mobile suits. It has a blue antenna on the back which enables Kio to control the C-Funnels. There is also a single horizontal line across the mouthpiece and its chin is colored blue instead of the standard red.

Similar to its predecessors being homages of the first 3 lead Gundams of the Universal Century, the Gundam AGE-FX serves as homage to the [[Nu Gundam]] due to having [[funnel (tool)|]] weapons.

title: type_99_light_machine_gun
body:
The Type 99 Light Machine Gun was a [[light machine gun]] designed for the [[Imperial Japanese Army]] for [[World War II]].  

The main reason for its development was the Type 99 used a 7.7mm [[cartridge]], while the older Type 96 used a 6.5mm cartridge.  The Imperial Japanese Army wanted to move the standard ammunition of the whole army to "7.7x58mm Arisaka,":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/7.7×58mm_Arisaka including a Type 99 Rifle introduced the same year, so that all soldiers could share ammunition. The previous 6.5mm cartridge was not considered powerful enough. 

However, they introduced the cartridge in 1939, just before the start of the war, and not enough of the new weapons could be produced. The Type 99 served alongside the Type 96 it was meant to replace, functionally resulting in just adding another set of ammunition and set of weapons that had to be tracked, rather than simplifying the process. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Type 99 light machine gun":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_99_light_machine_gun

title: constantia_s2
body:
A playable unit in [[Last Origin]].

She is a bioroid belonging to the Battle Maids Project series and is part of Squad 21. She is one of the first characters met by the [[Commander (last origin)|]].

Her weapon of choice is a custom [[Winchester Model 1866]] and she is often accompanied by her [[dog]], called [[Bori (last origin)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[green eyes]], and has [[large breasts]]. Her base skin consists of a [[maid]] outfit, featuring a prominent [[underboob cutout]], a short [[maid apron|apron]] and a [[miniskirt]]. She wears a [[pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]]. On her head she dons a [[maid headdress|headdress]] and a pair of [[round eyewear|round glasses]]. Her hair is styled in [[ponytail]] using a [[white ribbon|white]] [[hair ribbon]].

She was designed by [[kakiman]] and is voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]] in the Japanese version.

h4. Official art

* !post #3636370: Default
* !post #3636372: Battle suit
* !post #5582470: Night dress

h4. See also

* [[Bori (Last Origin)|]]

title: winchester_model_1894
body:
A [[lever-action]] repeating [[rifle]] designed in 1894 by John Browning. By far the most popular of the Winchester rifle family, the Model 1894 was the first commercially-available rifle to chamber cartridges using smokeless powder and is the best-selling high-powered rifle in US history, with more than 7 million units sold. Reproductions are still in production today.

As opposed to its predecessor, the [[winchester_model_1873|Model 1873]], the Model 1894 can be distinguished by its rounded receiver (the 1873 is more blocky) as well as being smaller in size by comparison. However, like the Model 1873, the Model 1894 features a grey-colored steel receiver, as opposed to the yellowish gunmetal seen on the [[winchester_model_1866|Model 1866]].

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* Wikipedia: "Winchester Model 1894":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winchester_Model_1894

title: winchester_model_1873
body:
The "Gun that Won the West", the .44 caliber Winchester Model 1873 was one of the most popular single firearms of the 19th Century, with over 700,000 sold by the time production ceased. The Model 1873 is distinguished from its predecessor, the [[winchester model 1866|Model 1866]], by its grey-colored steel receiver, and from its successor the [[winchester model 1894|Model 1894]] by it's size and the fact that its receiver is a squared shape, while the latter is smaller and more rounded. 

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]

title: winchester_model_1866
body:
The first in the long and hugely successful series of Winchester lever-action rifles, developed from the 1860 [[Henry rifle]].  The Winchester '66 can readily be distinguished from the Henry by the presence of a wooden forward stock, and by the King's Patent Loading Gate on the right side of the receiver. It can be distinguished from subsequent Winchester lever guns by the fact that its receiver is, like the Henry's, made from yellow gunmetal (a bronze/brass alloy) rather than steel.

h4. See also

* [[Henry Rifle]]
* [[Winchester Model 1873]]
* [[Winchester Model 1894]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: hiiragi_nemu
body:
A character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. She is one of the three leaders of the Wings of Magius and best friends with [[Satomi Touka|Touka]] & [[Tamaki Ui|Ui]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] stylized in [[hair rings]], [[twin braids]] & [[parted bangs|parted]] [[bangs]]. As a [[magical girl]] she wears a [[black cape|black]] [[cape]], a [[black headwear|black]] [[mortarboard]] [[hat]], [[tassel]], [[yellow dress]], and [[black  pantyhose]]. Usually seen [[holding book|holding]] a [[book]].

She is voiced by [[Morohoshi Sumire]].

title: orie_mishiro
body:
織衛 御白 (おりえ みしろ)

Mishiro is a character originally designed for [[Pixiv Fantasia Fallen Kings]] by [[konshin]].

She is a white fox girl with [[long_hair|long]] [[white hair]] with the tips [[gradient_hair|fading to blue]], [[blue eyes]] along with (obviously) drooping [[fox ears]] and a fluffy [[fox tail]].

She has the ability to turn into a [[fox]] and into a [[sword]]. She is the wife (and main weapon) of [[Orie Jinku]]. With him, she produced four children: [[orie_hakua|Hakua]], [[orie_kureha|Kureha]], [[orie_mitsugi|Mitsugi]], and [[orie_mihane|Mihane]].

title: nintendo_land
body: A 2012 party video game developed by [[Nintendo]] for the [[Wii U]] console. It serves as a “virtual theme park,” featuring 12 different mini-games (referred to as attractions), each inspired by popular Nintendo franchises like [[Mario (series)|Super Mario]], [[The Legend of Zelda]], [[Metroid]], [[Pikmin (series)|Pikmin]], and others.

title: spread_pussy_from_compression
body:
The [[pussy]] is spread open due to external compression, such as from pressing against an object or surface, without the use of hands or sexual actions like [[gaping]]. This tag focuses on the visible effect of deformation caused by pressure.

h4. See also

[[against transparent object]]
[[ass press]]

title: chuckya
body:
An enemy introduced in [[Super Mario 64]]. If they grab you, they'll chuck you away. 

Their body is that of a purple sphere and they have red spheres for hands as well as a red sphere on top of an antennae above their head. [[Super Mario 64 DS]] gives them a yellow wind up key in the back.

Despite being related to the [[Bob-Omb]]s, it does not have a fuse or explode in a way a bomb would.

title: api:bulk_update_requests
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 2. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 3. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 4. "Actions":#dtext-actions
** 4.01 "Index":#dtext-index
** 4.02 "Show":#dtext-show
** 4.03 "Create":#dtext-create
** 4.04 "Update":#dtext-update
** 4.05 "Delete":#dtext-delete
** 4.06 "Approve":#dtext-approve
* 5. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 6. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the upload records through the API.

[tn][b]Note:[/b] Only upload records created by oneself are visible, unless you are an Admin ([[Help:Users]]).[/tn]

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]user_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_topic_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_post_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]script[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]status[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][code][pending, approved, rejected, processing, failed][/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]user[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_topic[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_topics|forum topic]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_posts|forum post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "bulk_update_requests"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "bulk_update_request"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#actions. Actions

These are the various actions that can be done with bulk update request records.

[hr]

h5#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/bulk_update_requests.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#search-attributes. Search attributes

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b][[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b][[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]][/b]
** [code]script[/code]
* [b][[help:user_syntax|User syntax]][/b]
** [code]user[/code]
** [code]approver[/code]
* [b][[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]][/b]
** [code]forum_topic[/code]
** [code]forum_post[/code]
** [code]tags[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. Special search parameters

* [code]status[/code] - The status of the bulk update request (separated by commas).

[hr]

h5#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/bulk_update_requests/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the bulk update request ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h5#Create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/uploads.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h6#create-parameters. Create parameters

* [b]Mandatory[/b]:
** [code]script[/code]
** [code]title[/code]
** [code]reason[/code]
** [code]forum_topic_id[/code]

[b]Note:[/b]If forum topic ID is present, then title will be ignored. If forum topic ID is absent, then title will be used to create a new forum topic. The reason will be used to create a new forum post.

[hr]

h5#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/bulk_update_request/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the bulk update request ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h6#update-parameters. Update parameters

* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]script[/code]

* [b]Admin-only parameters[/b]:
** [code]forum_post_id[/code]
** [code]forum_topic_id[/code]

[hr]

h5#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/bulk_update_request/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the bulk update request ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] Only the user that created the bulk update request or an Admin may delete it.

[hr]

h5#approve. Approve

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/bulk_update_request/$id/approve.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the bulk update request ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] Builders and above can approve bulk update requests that:

[quote]
* Rename or alias
* Only artist tags
* Post count must be less than 200
[/quote]

Otherwise, only an admin may approve that request.
[hr]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/bulk_update_requests_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/bulk_update_request.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/bulk_update_request_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the user records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]

[th]Type[/th]

[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]

[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]level[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][10, 20, 30, 31, 32, 40, 50][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]inviter_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_update_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]note_update_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_upload_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]favorite_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]unread_dmail_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_banned[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]bit_prefs[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]Each bit stores a boolean value. See "Bit fields":[#dtext-bit-fields] below for more information.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]theme[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][light, dark][/td]
[/tr]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

[table]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is created at descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]name[/code]
* [b]"User syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:user_syntax][/b]
** [code]inviter[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]name_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on the name field.
* [code]min_level[/code] - Minimum user level to include.
* [code]max_level[/code] - Maximum user level to include.
* [code]current_user_first[/code] - Shows the current user first, then all other users by ID desc.
* [code]order[/code] - Sets the order of results.
** [code]name[/code] - Alphabetical on the name field.
** [code]post_upload_count[/code]
** [code]post_update_count[/code]
** [code]note_count[/code]

h5#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the user ID.
Can also be reached by using the [code]/profile[/code] endpoint for the current user.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: api:uploads
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 2. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 3. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 4. "Actions":#dtext-actions
** 4.01 "Index":#dtext-index
** 4.02 "Show":#dtext-show
** 4.03 "Delete":#dtext-delete
* 5. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 6. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the upload records through the API.

[tn][b]Note:[/b] Only upload records created by oneself are visible, unless you are an Admin ([[Help:Users]]).[/tn]

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]uploader_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]source[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]referer_url[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]media_asset_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]status[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]error[/code][/td]
[td]string or null[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]uploader[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]upload_media_assets[/code][/td]
[td]upload media asset[/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]media_assets[/code][/td]
[td]media asset[/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]posts[/code][/td]
[td][[api:posts|post]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "uploads"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "upload"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#actions. Actions

These are the various actions that can be done with upload records.

h5#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/uploads.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h6#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]media_asset_count[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]status[/code]
** [code]source[/code]
** [code]referer_url[/code]
* [[help:post_syntax|Post syntax]]
** [code]post[/code]
* [b]"User syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:user_syntax][/b]
** [code]uploader[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
** [code]media_assets[/code]
** [code]upload_media_assets[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]is_posted[/code] - Whether to show uploads that have a post or not ([[Help:Boolean syntax]]).

h5#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/uploads/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the upload ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h5#Create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/uploads.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]
 

h6#create-parameters. "Create parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Mandatory[/b]: One of these values must be present.
** [code]source[/code]
** [code]files[/code] ([tn]"array file format":[/wiki_pages/help:hash_syntax#dtext-array-of-files])[/tn]
* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]referer_url[/code]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/uploads_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/upload.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/upload_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: api:tag_aliases
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Record field format":#dtext-record

* 6. "Delete":#dtext-delete

* 08. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the tag alias records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]antecedent_name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]consequent_name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]status[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td]includes [active, deleted, retired][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]reason[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td]unused[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_topic_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0 or null[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_post_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0 or null[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]creator_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0 or null[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. "Associated attributes":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-associated-attributes]

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]creator[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]User that created the alias.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]approver[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]User that approved the alias.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_topic[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_topics|forum topic]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Forum topic where the aliasas discussed.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]forum_post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_posts|forum post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Forum post which started the alias discussion.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]antecedent_tag[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tags|tag]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]Tag of the antecedent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]consequent_tag[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tags|tag]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]Tag of the consequent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]antecedent_wiki[/code][/td]
[td][[api:wiki_pages|wiki page]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Wiki page of the antecedent.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]consequent_wiki[/code][/td]
[td][[api:wiki_pages|wiki page]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td]Wiki page of the consequent.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

** Used in the URL pathname

[tr]

[tr]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]antecedent_name[/code]
** [code]consequent_name[/code]

** [code]creator[/code]
** [code]approver[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
* [code]forum_topic[/code]
* [code]forum_post[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]name_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on the antecedent name or consequent name fields.
* [code]status[/code] - Case-insensitive search on the status field.
* [code]category[/code] - Searches on the category of the consequent tag, with support for multiple categories being space-delimited.

h5#search-order. Search order

Using the search parameter [code]order[/code] with one of the following values changes the order of the results.

* [code]created_at[/code] - Orders by created_at descending.
* [code]updated_at[/code] - Orders by updated_at descending.
* [code]name[/code] - Alphabetical order on the antecedent, then alphabetical order on the consequent.
* [code]tag_count[/code] - Orders by post count of the consequent tag, then alphabetical order on the antecedent, then alphabetical order on the consequent.
* [code]custom[/code] - See "here":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-custom-order] for more info.

[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the forum topic records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]title[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]category_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][0,1,2][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]response_count[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]min_level[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]Corresponds to the level of user ([[API:Users]]).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deleted[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_sticky[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_locked[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]creator_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#category-id. Category ID

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Value[/th]
[th]Description[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]0[/td]
[td]General[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]1[/td]
[td]Tags[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]2[/td]
[td]Bugs & features[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. "Associated attributes":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-associated-attributes]

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]creator[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]User that created the forum topic.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updater[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]User that last updated the forum topic.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]original_post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:forum_posts|forum post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td]The first forum post of a forum topic.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#Nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "forum_topics"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "forum_topic"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is updated at descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]category_id[/code]
** [code]response_count[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]title[/code]
* [[help:user_syntax|User syntax]]
** [code]creator[/code]
** [code]updater[/code]
* [[help:boolean_syntax|Boolean syntax]]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
** [code]is_sticky[/code]
** [code]is_locked[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
** [code]forum_posts[/code]
** [code]bulk_update_requests[/code]
** [code]tag_aliases[/code]
** [code]tag_implications[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]title_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the title text field.
* [code]status[/code] - The status of an attached [[api:bulk_update_requests|BUR]]. Can be: pending, approved, rejected.
* [code]is_private[/code] - Shows topics that have a min level set or not ([[Help:Boolean syntax]]).
* [code]is_read[/code] - Shows topics that have been read by the user or not ([[Help:Boolean syntax]]).
* [code]is_deleted[/code] - Unless this value is present, [u]deleted forum_topics are hidden[/u].

h5#search-order. Search order

Using the search parameter [code]order[/code] with one of the following values changes the order of the results.

* [code]sticky[/code] - Shows sticky topics first, sorted by updated at second.
* [code]post_count[/code] - Orders by post count.

The order can also be changed to ID descending by using "sequential pagination":[/wiki_pages/help%3Acommon_url_parameters#dtext-sequential].

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum topic ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. [[help:api_write_requests|Create parameters]]

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]title[/code]
** [code]category_id[/code] - Can be: 0, 1, 2.
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]original_post_attributes[body][/code] - DText that will be used to create a forum post entry at the same time.
*** Is a hash value, so the final parameter format is [code]forum_topic[original_post_attributes][body][/code]

h6.Restricted to Moderator+

* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]min_level[/code] - Can be: 0, 40, 50
** [code]is_sticky[/code]
** [code]is_locked[/code]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum topic ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. [[help:api_write_requests|Update parameters]]

Accepts the "same parameters":[#dtext-create-parameters] as the "create forum topic action":[#dtext-create]. All parameters are optional. Besides those, it also accepts the following additional optional parameters.

* [code]original_post_attributes[id][/code] - The ID of the the first post on a topic.
** Is a hash value, so the final parameter format is [code]forum_topic[original_post_attributes][id][/code]
** This parameter [u]is required[/u] if the original post's body is being updated as well.

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum topic ID.
Restricted to Moderator+.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update forum topic action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]true[/b].

h4#undelete. Undelete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics/$id/undelete.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the forum topic ID.
Restricted to moderator+.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update forum topic action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]false[/b].

h4#mark-all-as-read. Mark all as read

Marks every topic as being read.

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/forum_topics/mark_all_as_read.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

title: api:dmails
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the dmail records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]owner_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]to_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]from_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td][/td]
[/tr]

[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_read[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deleted[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_spam[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td]obsolete[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]key[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]owner[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]to[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]from[/code][/td]
[td][[api:users|user]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "dmails"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "dmail"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] none

h4#actions. Actions

These are the various actions that can be done with dmail records.

h5#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/dmails.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.
Only Dmails to or from the user will be shown, regardless of user level.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]title[/code]
** [code]body[/code]
* [b]"User syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:user_syntax][/b]
** [code]to[/code]
** [code]from[/code]
* [b]"Boolean syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:boolean_syntax][/b]
** [code]is_read[/code]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]title_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on the title fields.
* [code]message_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on the body field.
* [code]folder_matches[/code]
** [b]received[/b] - Shows all dmails to the user.
** [b]unread[/b] - Shows all unread dmails to the user.
** [b]sent[/b] - Shows all dmails from the user.
** [b]deleted[/b] - Shows all dmails deleted by the user.

h5#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/dmails/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the dmail ID.
Normally only the owner can see the dmail, unless the correct dmail key is also supplied.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#show-parameters. Show parameters.

* [code]key[/code] Unique key for every dmail that will allow anyone to view the dmail.

h5#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/dmails.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#create-parameters. "Create parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [b]To specifier:[/b] - must be one of the following
*** [code]to_id[/code]
*** [code]to_name[/code]
** [code]title[/code]
** [code]body[/code]

h5#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/dmails/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the dmail ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#update-parameters. "Update parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]is_read[/code]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]

h5#mark-all-as-read. Mark all as read

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/dmails/mark_all_as_read[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]

h4#record. Record field format

[table]

[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the wiki page records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]title[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]body[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]other_names[/code][/td]
[td]array[/td]
[td]strings[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deleted[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]locked[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#derived. Derived field format

These are values which are not part of the actual record, but instead are derived from calculations and record lookups on the fly.

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[th]Notes[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]category_name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][0,1,3,4,5,null][/td]
[td]It is the [code]category[/code] of the "associated tag":[#dtext-associations] if it exists, otherwise it is null.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]tag[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tags|tag]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]artist[/code][/td]
[td][[api:artists|artist]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]dtext_links[/code][/td]
[td][[api:dtext_links|dtext link]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "wiki_pages"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "wiki_page"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] [[API:Wiki page versions]]

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is updated at descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [[help:number_syntax|Number syntax]]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [[help:text_syntax|Text syntax]]
** [code]title[/code]
** [code]body[/code]
* [[help:array_syntax|Array syntax]]
** [code]other_names[/code]
* [[help:boolean_syntax|Boolean syntax]]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
** [code]is_locked[/code]
* [[help:chaining_syntax|Chaining syntax]]
** [code]tag[/code]
** [code]artist[/code]
** [code]dtext_links[/code]

h6#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]body_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the body text field.
* [code]title_normalize[/code] - Normalized case-insensitive wildcard searching on the title text field.
* [code]other_names_match[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard search on any of the other names.
* [code]linked_to[/code] - All wiki pages that link to the given wiki title.
* [code]not_linked_to[/code] - All wiki pages that do not link to the given wiki title.
* [code]hide_deleted[/code] - Hides all deleted wikis (boolean syntax).
** Shortcut for [code]search[is_deleted]=false[/code]
* [code]other_names_present[/code] - Shows wikis based on the presence of other names (boolean syntax).
** Shortcut for [code]search[other_name_count]=>0[/code] (TRUE) and [code]search[other_name_count]=0[/code] (FALSE)
* [code]order[/code] - Sets the order of results.
** [code]title[/code] - Alphabetical order on the title.
** [code]post_count[/code] - Orders by post count.

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the wiki page ID or title.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. Create parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]title[/code]
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]body[/code]
** [code]other_names[/code] - Uses URL array parameter format.
** [code]other_names_string[/code] - Space delimited list of post IDs.
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
** [code]is_locked[/code]

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the wiki page ID or title.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. Update parameters

Accepts the "same parameters":[#dtext-create-parameters] as the "create wiki page action":[#dtext-create]. All parameters are optional.

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the wiki page ID or title.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update wiki page action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]true[/b].

h4#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/wiki_pages/$id/revert.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the wiki page ID or title.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#revert-parameters. Revert parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** version_id - The wiki page version ID to revert to.

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/wiki_pages_controller.rb>[/td]

[tr]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "posts"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "post"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] [[API:Post versions]]

h4#actions. Actions

These are the various actions that can be done with upload records.

h5#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/posts.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#index-parameters. Index parameters

* [code]tags[/code] - The post query to search for using tags and metatags ([[Help:Cheatsheet]]).
** [code]post[tags][/code] can also be used.
* [code]random[/code] - Selects a random sampling under the post query.
* [code]format[/code] - Chooses which format to return. Can be: html, json, xml, atom.
* [code]md5[/code] - Search for an MD5 match. Takes priority over all other parameters.

h5#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/posts/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the post ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create. Create

[table]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td]/posts.json[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

h6#create-parameters. "Create parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Mandatory[/b]:
** [code]upload_media_asset_id[/code]
* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]tag_string[/code]
** [code]rating[/code]
** [code]parent_id[/code]
** [code]source[/code]
** [code]artist_commentary_title[/code]
** [code]artist_commentary_desc[/code]
** [code]translated_commentary_title[/code]
** [code]translated_commentary_desc[/code]
** [code]is_pending[/code] - only matters for users with unrestricted uploads.

h5#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/posts/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]$id is the post ID[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#update-parameters. "Update parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Optional[/b]:
** [code]tag_string[/code]
** [code]old_tag_string[/code]
** [code]parent_id[/code]
** [code]old_parent_id[/code]
** [code]source[/code]
** [code]old_source[/code]
** [code]rating[/code]
** [code]old_rating[/code]
** [code]has_embedded_notes[/code]

h5#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/posts/$id/revert.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h6#revert-parameters. Revert parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** version_id - The post version ID to revert to.

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/posts_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/post.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/post_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: api:notes
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 01. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 02. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 03. "Nomenclature":#dtext-nomenclature
* 04. "Index":#dtext-index
* 05. "Show":#dtext-show
* 06. "Create":#dtext-create
* 07. "Update":#dtext-update
* 08. "Delete":#dtext-delete
* 09. "Revert":#dtext-revert
* 10. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 10. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the note records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]body[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]x[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]y[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]width[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]height[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_active[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]version[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]post[/code][/td]
[td][[api:posts|post]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]required[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "notes"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "note"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] [[API:Note versions]]

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/notes.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. Search attributes

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]x[/code]
** [code]y[/code]
** [code]width[/code]
** [code]height[/code]
** [code]version[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]body[/code]
* [b]"Boolean syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:boolean_syntax][/b]
** [code]is_active[/code]
* [b]"Post syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:post_syntax][/b]
** [code]post[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. Special search parameters

* [code]body_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the body text field.

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/notes/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the note ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This does a redirect to the post with that note when using the HTML interface, specifically highlighting that note when it gets there.

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/notes.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. Create parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]post_id[/code] - The post ID the note belongs to.
** [code]x[/code] - X coordinate of the note starting from the left of the image.
** [code]y[/code] - y coordinate of the note starting from the top of the image.
** [code]height[/code]
** [code]width[/code]
** [code]body[/code]
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]is_active[/code] - Whether the note is active or not (i.e. deleted).

[b]Note:[/b] The note box must fit within the full-size dimensions of the image.

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/notes/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the note ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. Update parameters

Accepts the "same parameters":[#dtext-create-parameters] as the "create note action":[#dtext-create], except for the post ID. All parameters are optional.

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/notes/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the note ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/notes/$id/revert.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the note ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#revert-parameters. Revert parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** version_id - The note version ID to revert to.

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/notes_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/note.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/note_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the pool records through the API.

[thead]

[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]description[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]post_ids[/code][/td]
[td]array[/td]
[td]integers > 0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]category[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][series, collection][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deleted[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_active[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td]unused[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

None.

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "pools"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "pool"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] [[API:Pool versions]]

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is updated at descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]name[/code]
** [code]description[/code]
* [b]"Array syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:array_syntax][/b]
** [code]post_ids[/code]
* [b]"Boolean syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:boolean_syntax][/b]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]name_matches[/code] - Normalized case-insensitive wildcard searching on the name text field.
* [code]description_matches[/code] - Case-insensitive wildcard searching on the description text field.
* [code]post_tags_match[/code] - The pools's post's tags match the given terms. Meta-tags not supported.
* [code]category[/code]
** [code]series[/code] - Only series-type pools.
** [code]collection[/code] - Only collection-type pools.
* [code]order[/code] - Sets the order of the results.
** [code]name[/code] - Alphabetic order by name.
** [code]created_at[/code] - Orders by creation time.
** [code]post_count[/code] - Orders by post count.

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the pool ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. Create parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]name[/code]
** [code]category[/code] - Can be: series, collection.
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]description[/code]
** [code]post_ids[/code] - Uses URL array parameter format.
** [code]post_ids_string[/code] - Space delimited list of post IDs.
** [code]is_deleted[/code]

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the pool ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. Update parameters

Accepts the "same parameters":[#dtext-create-parameters] as the "create pool action":[#dtext-create]. All parameters are optional.

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the pool ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update pool action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]true[/b].

h4#undelete. Undelete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools/$id/undelete.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the pool ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] This action can also be accomplished using the "update pool action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]false[/b].

h4#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/pools/$id/revert.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the pool ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#revert-parameters. Revert parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** version_id - The pool version ID to revert to.

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/pools_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/pool.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/pool_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: api:artists
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 01. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 02. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
* 03. "Index":#dtext-index
* 04. "Show":#dtext-show
* 05. "Create":#dtext-create
* 06. "Update":#dtext-update
* 07. "Delete":#dtext-delete
* 08. "Banned":#dtext-banned
* 09. "Revert":#dtext-revert
* 10. "See also":#dtext-see-also
* 11. "External links":#dtext-external-links
[/expand]

The following includes the details of how to interface with the artist records through the API.

h4#record. Record field format

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]id[/code][/td]
[td]integer[/td]
[td]>0[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][[api:tags|tag format]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]group_name[/code][/td]
[td]string[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]other_names[/code][/td]
[td]array[/td]
[td]strings[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_banned[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]is_deleted[/code][/td]
[td]boolean[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]created_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]updated_at[/code][/td]
[td]timestamp[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#associations. Associated attributes

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Name[/th]
[th]Type[/th]
[th]Number[/th]
[th]Availability[/th]
[th]Details[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][code]members[/code][/td]
[td][[api:artists|artist]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]urls[/code][/td]
[td][[api:artist_urls|artist url]][/td]
[td]multiple[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]wiki_page[/code][/td]
[td][[api:wiki_pages|wiki page]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag_alias[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tag_aliases|tag alias]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][code]tag[/code][/td]
[td][[api:tags|tag]][/td]
[td]single[/td]
[td]optional[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#nomenclature. Nomenclature

* [b]Plural form:[/b] "artists"
** Used in the URL pathname
* [b]Singular form:[/b] "artist"
** Used for write parameters ([[Help:API Write Requests]])
* [b]Versions:[/b] [[API:Artist versions]]

h4#index. Index

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]The default order is ID descending.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#search-attributes. "Search attributes":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

All of the following are standard attributes with all of their available formats and qualifiers.

* [b]"Number syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:number_syntax][/b]
** [code]id[/code]
** [code]created_at[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
* [b]"Text syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:text_syntax][/b]
** [code]name[/code]
** [code]group_name[/code]
* [b]"Boolean syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:boolean_syntax][/b]
** [code]is_deleted[/code]
** [code]is_banned[/code]
* [b]"Array syntax":[/wiki_pages/help:array_syntax][/b]
** [code]other_names[/code]

h5#special-search-parameters. "Special search parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:common_url_parameters#dtext-search]

* [code]any_other_name_like[/code] - Search for artists that have an other name matching this value. Supports wildcards.
* [code]any_name_matches [/code] - Search for artists that have a matching name, group name, or other name. Supports wildcards and regexes.
* [code]url_matches[/code] - Search for artists with a matching URL.
** Does a regex match when the query starts and ends with a forward slash "/".
*** Regexes must follow the Ruby's format.
** Does a wildcard match when there are asterisks "*" present.
** Uses the artist URL finder when the value is prefaced by [code]http://[/code] or [code]https://[/code]
*** This does a recursive search on URLs stripping the pathname one level at a time to search for matches.
*** It will keep searching until it finds an exact match or 10 similar entries.
** Otherwise it does a wildcard search with wildcard placed at the start and end.
* [code]any_name_or_url_matches[/code] - Searches for the artist by name or URL.
** Does a URL search if the value is prefaced by [code]http://[/code] or [code]https://[/code]
** Does a name search otherwise.
* [code]order[/code] - Sets the order of the results.
** [code]name[/code]
** [code]updated_at[/code]
** [code]post_count[/code]

h4#show. Show

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#create. Create

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]POST[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#create-parameters. "Create parameters":[/wiki_pages/help:api_write_requests]

* [b]Required[/b]:
** [code]name[/code]- The artist tag name.
*** Must be tag format ([[API:tags]]).
* [b]Optional[/b]
** [code]group_name[/code] - The name of the group this artist belongs to.
** [code]other_names[/code] - List of alternative names for this artist.
*** Space delimited. Replace spaces within names with underscores.
** [code]url_string[/code] - List of URLs associated with this artist
*** Whitespace or newline delimited.
** [code]is_deleted[/code] - Set the artist entry as deleted or not.

h4#update. Update

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT/PATCH[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#update-parameters. Update parameters

Accepts the "same parameters":[#dtext-create-parameters] as the "create artist action":[#dtext-create]. All parameters are optional.

h4#delete. Delete

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]DELETE[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[b]Note:[/b] The action can be accomplished using the "update artist action":[#dtext-update] by setting [code]is_deleted[/code] to [b]true[/b].

h4#banned. Banned

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]GET[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/banned.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_read_requests|read request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td]Redirects to the "index artist action":[#dtext-index] with [code]is_banned[/code] set to [b]true[/b].[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#revert. Revert

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id/revert.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#revert-parameters. Revert parameters

* [b]Required[/b]:
** version_id - The artist version ID to revert to.

h4#ban. Ban

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id/ban.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.
Restricted to Admins only ([[Help:Users]])[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#ban. Unban

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]HTTP Method[/b][/td]
[td]PUT[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Base URL[/b][/td]
[td][code]/artists/$id/unban.json[/code][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Type[/b][/td]
[td][[help:api_write_requests|write request]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Description[/b][/td]
[td][code]$id[/code] is the artist ID.
Restricted to Admins only ([[Help:Users]])[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[Help:Common URL Parameters]]
* [[Help:API]]

h4#external-links. External links

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td][b]Controller[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/controllers/artists_controller.rb>[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Model[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/models/artist.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][b]Policy[/b][/td]
[td]<https://github.com/danbooru/danbooru/blob/master/app/policies/artist_policy.rb>[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: api:forum_posts
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* 01. "Record field format":#dtext-record
* 02. "Associated attributes":#dtext-associations
